snippet: The reinterpretation of the country’s pacifist postwar Constitution is disturbing and has increased anxiety in an already tense region.
abstract: Editorial contends it is disturbing that Japan's Prime Min Shinzo Abe has reinterpreted his country's pacifist postwar Constitution so that military can be more assertive; asserts change has increased anxiety in region that needs to reduce tension.
lead_paragraph: The reinterpretation of the country’s pacifist postwar Constitution is disturbing and has increased anxiety in an already tense region.
